text: The PR1 women's single sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. A top-seven finish ensured qualification for the Tokyo Paralympics. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Monday 26 August 2019 || 10:00 || Heats |- | Wednesday 28 August 2019 || 09:30 || Repechage |- | Friday 30 August 2019 || 10:40 || Semifinals A/B |- | rowspan=3|Sunday 1 September 2019 || 10:35 || Final C |- | 11:18 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 13:05 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== The three fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechage. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Moran Samuel | align="left"| | 10:50.50 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Sylvia Pille-Steppat | align="left"| | 11:36.45 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Wang Lili | align="left"| | 12:04.62 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Ebba Einarsson | align="left"| | 12:37.34 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Sandra Khumalo | align="left"| | 13:27.21 | R |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Nathalie Benoit | align="left"| | 10:59.78 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Anna Sheremet | align="left"| | 11:08.16 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Brenda Sardón | align="left"| | 11:57.81 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Kim Se-jeong | align="left"| | 12:01.57 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Tomomi Ichikawa | align="left"| | 12:56.69 | R |} ====Heat 3==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Birgit Skarstein | align="left"| | 10:55.58 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Hallie Smith | align="left"| | 11:33.30 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Liudmila Vauchok | align="left"| | 11:52.57 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Anila Hoxha | align="left"| | 12:12.54 | R |} ===Repechage=== The three fastest boats advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the C final. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Kim Se-jeong | align="left"| | 11:35.72 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Anila Hoxha | align="left"| | 11:51.92 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Ebba Einarsson | align="left"| | 12:20.15 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Sandra Khumalo | align="left"| | 12:26.55 | FC |- | 5 | align="left"|Tomomi Ichikawa | align="left"| | 12:27.08 | FC |} ===Semifinals=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Nathalie Benoit | align="left"| | 10:35.65 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Moran Samuel | align="left"| | 10:51.81 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Hallie Smith | align="left"| | 11:14.59 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Kim Se-jeong | align="left"| | 11:34.61 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Brenda Sardón | align="left"| | 12:01.28 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Ebba Einarsson | align="left"| | 12:31.96 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Birgit Skarstein | align="left"| | 10:32.45 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Anna Sheremet | align="left"| | 10:46.96 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Sylvia Pille-Steppat | align="left"| | 11:19.23 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Liudmila Vauchok | align="left"| | 11:30.77 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Wang Lili | align="left"| | 11:43.97 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Anila Hoxha | align="left"| | 11:51.17 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the other finals. ====Final C==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Sandra Khumalo | align="left"| | 12:25.94 |- | 2 | align="left"|Tomomi Ichikawa | align="left"| | 12:29.24 |} ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Kim Se-jeong | align="left"| | 11:38.94 |- | 2 | align="left"|Liudmila Vauchok | align="left"| | 11:40.17 |- | 3 | align="left"|Brenda Sardón | align="left"| | 11:55.08 |- | 4 | align="left"|Wang Lili | align="left"| | 11:55.85 |- | 5 | align="left"|Anila Hoxha | align="left"| | 12:16.42 |- | 6 | align="left"|Ebba Einarsson | align="left"| | 12:42.37 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Birgit Skarstein | align="left"| | 10:18.83 |- | | align="left"|Nathalie Benoit | align="left"| | 10:24.07 |- | | align="left"|Moran Samuel | align="left"| | 10:30.19 |- | 4 | align="left"|Anna Sheremet | align="left"| | 10:40.57 |- | 5 | align="left"|Sylvia Pille-Steppat | align="left"| | 11:07.08 |- | 6 | align="left"|Hallie Smith | align="left"| | 11:12.92 |} ==References== Category:2019 World Rowing Championships World
